intro: Dupatya dubia, commonly known as the white-flowered strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dupatya dubia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
